title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
flaviusolaru left at 00:02 (Read error: Connection reset by peer flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 00:02 bblfish - (01:09): thanks sdumitriu. CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:32): I think I found a bug. Create a page with just a velocity macro and put only an empty html macro inside. SaveAndContinue works and the page can be viewed. SaveAndView throws a velocity macro error which won't go away when refreshing the page. CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:33): http://tinypaste.com/907a9 sdumitriu - (01:34): Strange sdumitriu - (01:35): Works for me CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:39): That is strange. I'm testing on a selenium test which I stalled. I'll try on my postgres installation. CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:42): Yup, works (no bug) on the postgres installation which is a little older. I'll upgrade and test again. sdumitriu - (01:43): Testing on 2.2 final sdumitriu - (01:43): WIth HSQL CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:46): 2.3 rev 27150 HQSL (selenium) bblfish left at 03:03 (Ping timeout: 246 seconds bblfish joined #xwiki at 03:07 oxi - (04:27): I fail to compile a "watch" snapshot oxi - (04:27): is there a compiled snapshot download available? sdumitriu - (04:27): Let me check oxi - (04:28): I followed the instructions sdumitriu - (04:28): http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-distribution-hsqldb/ oxi - (04:28): however, I don't want to dig deeper into this right now oxi - (04:28): thanks a lot! oxi - (04:28): this should work with the current Enterprise Version? sdumitriu - (04:30): Yes oxi - (04:30): perfect oxi - (04:30): this is confusing me: xwiki-watch-distribution-hsqldb-2.2-....... oxi - (04:30): I'm using Apache Derby, not HSQLDB sdumitriu - (04:31): Never mind that oxi - (04:31): good sdumitriu - (04:31): This is a full watch  build sdumitriu - (04:31): You'll have to extract the required jars from it and move them to your running Enterprise oxi - (04:35): sdumitriu: only extract wabapps/xwiki from the zip? oxi - (04:35): and it doesn't matter that it came with jetty and I'm using tomcat? sdumitriu - (04:35): Not the whole webapps/xwiki sdumitriu - (04:36): Just the jars required by Watch, from webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/libs oxi - (04:36): there is no xar file available, right? oxi - (04:36): how do I know which ones are required? sdumitriu - (04:37): http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-wikis-watch/ sdumitriu - (04:37): Sorry, I'm sleepy, lucaa will be able to help you more once she wakes up oxi - (04:39): ... oxi - (04:41): so I guess lib/xwiki-watch-gwt-client-1.1-SNAPSHOT.jar; lib/xwiki-watch-gwt-server-1.1-SNAPSHOT.jar; gwt-servlet-1.5.3.jar sdumitriu - (04:42): gwt-servlet should be there already sdumitriu - (04:42): A more recent version oxi - (04:42): true, gwt-servlet-2.0.0.jar oxi - (04:44): which xar file can I use? oxi - (04:44): there's no xar file in http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-wikis-watch/ sdumitriu - (04:46): Yes there is sdumitriu - (04:47): http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-wikis-watch/1.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-watch-wikis-watch-1.1-20090923.093231-2.xar oxi - (04:51): thanks oxi - (04:52): I copied xwiki-watch-gwt-client-1.1-20090923.09321-2.jar and xwiki-watch-gwt-server-1.1-20090923.09321-2.jar to my WEB-INF/lib oxi - (04:53): Do I also need gwt-user.jar and gwt-dev.jar from gwt-2.0.2.zip? oxi - (04:54): I guess I can safely replace gwt-servlet.2.0.0.jar with gwt-servlet.2.0.2.jar oxi - (04:56): what do you think about gwt-user-2.0.2.jar and gwt-dev-2.0.2.jar oxi - (04:56): do I need them? oxi - (04:58): should I delete the gwt-user-2.0.2.jar/javax/servlet classpath to prevent a collision with tomcat's servlet api? oxi - (05:07): should I import the xar using "import package" in xwiki enterprise? sdumitriu left at 05:11 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds shelan joined #xwiki at 05:59 oxi left at 06:01 (Quit: oxi oxi joined #xwiki at 06:21 oxi left at 07:02 (Quit: oxi hcross1 left at 07:36 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds hcross1 joined #xwiki at 07:54 vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:05 shelan left at 08:31 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds vmassol left at 09:49 (Quit: Leaving. lucaa left #xwiki at 10:32 sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:41 A-Kaser joined #xwiki at 10:44 A-Kaser left #xwiki at 11:37 xipe\_ left at 12:50 (\*.net \*.split xipe joined #xwiki at 12:54 oxi joined #xwiki at 13:23 oxi left at 13:23 (Client Quit vmassol joined #xwiki at 14:39 bblfish - (14:41): does one have to do something in velocity to convert a string into a number when passing it as an argument to a java method that takes an int or a float? sdumitriu - (14:41): Yes sdumitriu - (14:42): (just a minute) bblfish - (14:42): ah thanks sdumitriu sdumitriu - (14:43): http://velocity.apache.org/tools/releases/1.4/generic/MathTool.html#toDouble%28%29 sdumitriu - (14:44): In XWiki, use $mathtool.function() bblfish - (14:50): thanks tmortagne joined #xwiki at 14:52 vmassol - (14:54): fyi the latest maven assembly plugin seem to have perf issues: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MASSEMBLY-424?focusedCommentId=210913&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action\_210913 vmassol - (14:54): we're using 2.2-beta-1 right so that's ok but we shouldn't upgrade probably npm left at 15:12 (Quit: Leaving. npm joined #xwiki at 15:14 bblfish left at 15:24 (Read error: Connection reset by peer bblfish\_ joined #xwiki at 15:24 bblfish\_ left at 15:27 (Read error: Connection reset by peer bblfish joined #xwiki at 15:31 oxi joined #xwiki at 15:45 flaviusolaru1 joined #xwiki at 16:10 flaviusolaru left at 16:12 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds tmortagne - (16:19): hi, i would need some CSS expert ;) tmortagne - (16:20): i have tmortagne - (16:20):
void toto() {}
tmortagne - (16:20): and tmortagne - (16:20): .code, .box { tmortagne - (16:20):   background-color: $theme.backgroundSecondaryColor; tmortagne - (16:20):   border: 1px dotted $theme.borderColor; tmortagne - (16:20): } tmortagne - (16:20): .code, .code pre  { tmortagne - (16:20):   font-family: courier, "courier new", monospace; tmortagne - (16:20):   white-space: pre; tmortagne - (16:20): } tmortagne - (16:20): and void is not monospaced tmortagne - (16:20): it doe snot looks like monospaced at least sdumitriu - (16:20): tmortagne: I'll take a look sdumitriu - (16:20): OTP right now tmortagne - (16:20): sdumitriu: ok, i have time don't worry, was a bottle in the sea ;) jvdrean joined #xwiki at 16:30 CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:33): jvdrean: Any comments on XAADMINISTRATION-112 before I start committing (since you are in charge of XAADMINISTRATION) sdumitriu - (16:33): Caleb: please let me read it too sdumitriu - (16:33): Can you wait until tomorrow? CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:33): Sure. CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:33): I could post a patch. CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:34): If it would help. sdumitriu - (16:35): Sure tmortagne - (16:38): sdumitriu: you can comment in http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4879 (or directly fix it ;)) when you have time sdumitriu - (16:39): K tmortagne - (16:39): (for my previous CSS question) CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:54): Patches are posted. I'm going to svn up and see if this still breaks the parser http://tinypaste.com/907a9 jvdrean left at 17:36 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds jvdrean joined #xwiki at 17:42 bblfish left at 17:49 (Read error: Connection reset by peer bblfish joined #xwiki at 17:49 flaviusolaru1 left at 18:01 (Read error: Connection reset by peer flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 18:03 hcross1 left at 19:35 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds hcross1 joined #xwiki at 19:52 flaviusolaru left at 20:18 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 20:32 jrieken left at 20:36 (Remote host closed the connection bblfish left at 20:50 (Ping timeout: 256 seconds vmassol left at 20:53 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne left at 20:55 (Quit: Leaving. bblfish joined #xwiki at 20:55 mflorea joined #xwiki at 21:26 CalebJamesDeLisl - (21:48): Why does the viewer load comments through xpage=xpart&vm=commentsinline.vm   xpage=commentsinline seems to do the same thing. sdumitriu - (21:49): xpart also parses xwikivars.vm CalebJamesDeLisl - (21:49): Ahh, Thanks. sdumitriu - (21:50): So it prepares variables like $hasEdit, $hasAdmin, $isGuest, etc vmassol joined #xwiki at 21:56 CalebJamesDeLisl - (21:57): I've been thinking that view ought to render the page the page first (maybe after xwikivars and layoutvars) then if a map called $display exists and $display.get('htmlheader') is set to false then htmlheader isn't included, then an application could suppress title, breadcrumb, menus etc. flaviusolaru1 joined #xwiki at 21:58 flaviusolaru left at 21:59 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds CalebJamesDeLisl - (21:59): Like $showcomments but more complete. I'd have no time to implement it for a while though. CalebJamesDeLisl - (22:09): correction: to suppress htmlheader the line would be #set($display = {startpage : {htmlheader : false}}) sdumitriu - (22:10): Hm... sdumitriu - (22:10): That is an interesting idea sdumitriu - (22:10): But hard to introduce now sdumitriu - (22:11): Since all the skins and templates depend on the current flow sdumitriu - (22:11): And this is not a problem for the official skins, but for all the customized instances sdumitriu - (22:11): Thus, it would make upgrades harder sdumitriu - (22:12): But yes, we need a way to exclude some elements from the rendered page vmassol left at 22:14 (Quit: Leaving. CalebJamesDeLisl - (22:14): Good point about messing up custom skins. vmassol joined #xwiki at 22:26 mflorea left at 22:26 (Quit: Leaving. vmassol left at 22:36 (Quit: Leaving. flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 23:04 flaviusolaru1 left at 23:06 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds lucaa joined #xwiki at 23:31 jvdrean left at 23:50 (Quit: Leaving.
